text:
Sessions should timeout due to user inactivity. I take this to mean that any 
activity within the specified timout interval should reset the timeout clock. 
The current implementation requires the user to access the session TWICE within 
the timout interval, instead of once, in order to prevent a timeout. To be 
clear, if the timeout period is set 30min, and a user logs in and then accesses 
the session once after 25 minutes and a second time 10 minutes later, the 
session will have incorrectly timed out before the second access.

I believe the problem is located with processExpires()in StandardManager. It 
uses session.getLastAccessedTime() to calculate the timeout period. 
getLastAccessedTime() returns the time to the previous request instead of the 
time to the most recent request.
